alert.note: Alert for Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 05 at 3:03PM AKST until January 07 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches are expected. West winds gusting to 55 mph with whiteout conditions expected. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM Friday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting to 55 mph will continue through Thursday night. Visibility will fall to near zero in whiteout conditions this afternoon when falling snow begins, with the visibility remaining very low through Thursday. Large snow drifts will form. The lowest visibility and worst conditions are expected from late this afternoon through Thursday afternoon. Conditions will slowly improve early Friday as winds slowly decrease. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
